comments.body: If it drops some kind of new meat, I'm for it
You should be able to give them food and they would give you small trinkets in return

Myth. Carrion is less than 5% of a crow's diet.
Although, everything else seems cool.

Ill put my suggestion for crows here since I think it fits with your post.

Crows but realistic (so they're as smart as 5yo)

Creo que sería genial que los tucanes tengan todos los colores de los loros, sean mas grandes, tengan un pico mas largo, no se canse en vuelo y no se dejen atrapar fácil (por lo que huya del jugador).

Los búhos por otro lado, serían igual de grandes, podrían ser marrones o grises, estos solo aparecen en la noche y si la atacas te daría un golpe y huiría, tendrían un pico mas corto.

Se podrían alimentar con semillas o podrían ser alimentados con algo que suelten los artrópodos (menos hilo)
This is a very good idea
Maybe make the warped potion permanent? A villager doesn't revert back to a zombie villager when the weakness wears off.
I've been wanting this for so long! I feel as though since there is one dragon in the whole game, there needs to be more in the overworld.

Alternatively, tameable dragons can also be added alongside the End Update in the future! But to prevent it from being too dangerous, we can make them as neutral mobs there. Tameable dragons have tons of potential to further improve Minecraft, from making youtube videos to roleplaying.
I support this
all deep parts of the world are supposed to be terrifying not all unicorns and happiness i like this idea
Haha......why not
This is interesting. Would the dragon just sleep down there forever? Could you then tame it, or would the portal open?
i love shrek references
They might find this too modern? But it sounds like a good idea!
this would make a reason for him to exist. thumbs up

maybe if u drop iron or other mined or smelted items if left on the ground . The warning is you hear ... TWEEET! And yes birds are awsome

i think this would be great, but not just magpies. maybe rooks and drongos that would be cool looking mimics that also ambush hostile mobs because it sees them as a threat. they should make a large bird update, including a hostile/ neutral bird cause there are currently none
they could collect sticks, still wandering what could tame them though, something found early in the game
they should be tamed with rotten flesh
Hey no taming them with rotten flesh! Check out my idea for base protection (FYI I’ve been swooped)

Bisons spawn in groups of 5 or 6.

If you hit a bison his group gets aggressive.

A variante of a bison, that lives in the mountains could be a yak.

Yaks spawn alone and build no goups.

Yaks can jump higher than bisons.
But how would they be different from chickens?
Some ducks could be grden and some brown, and geese could be grey
Good idea.

they already imitate other mobs nearby to warn you (you can tell by the mobs voice being low-pitched)
They could drop a new Totem that allows you to control a monster like a pet. Using it may or may not consume the totem

Theres no point in it a map of a woodland mansion is useless because woodland mansions dont have much value to them and the chances of them spawning are to low for anyone to realy notice the features exists
that is too OP
yah  but it's not like they are spawning constantly, they would even less common the evoker which have similar powers just different mobs. There would be a limit to the monster tamer's power.

While I don't think players would like mice stealing items from them, I do support them being added to the game. I think that it would give more interaction with some of the other animals in the game. Mice would be prey to foxes, cats, parrots, wild dogs even eat mice. It would also be nice if we could tame them and have them as pets.
Yes and it would add to securing your chests even on a single player.

It would add onto the abandoned villages if mice were present and scurried around when the player gets close to them. It would also be neat if they spawned in player-made structures in chunks that have not been entered in many in game days. They could also chew through tripwire
I would call it a Dripstone Crab and make it a bit more like a hermit crab. It would crawl on floors and ceilings, and if a player goes underneath they would drop their shell and then regrow it
it might also have nests in the dirpstone blocks and just like a silver fish more will come is broken but if on is attcked more will not come

I love this idea, but i would add one thing. There should be a varient of the Dripstone Mites that walks on the ceiling of the Dripstone caves. Exept it would be bigger and extremely hostile if you even enter the biome. Instead of just attacking you, it could drop the dripstone on its back to you, and after that be more vulnerable to bows and melee weapons. In this state, it would just keep running uin the ceiling until it finds a dripstone block to eat, and then regrow the stalagtite on its back, ready to attack again.
Owwwww... Very nice Idea!

baby villiagers should have hair and a chubby face

It would be great if i have a moobloom but not just dandelions all over flowers too!
It was going to be great if i had a moobloom but not just dandelions all other flowers too!
If i shear a moobloom one of their dandelions will fall off and I will get a different flower instead of a dandelion but if i shear it the mooblooms will not turn into regular cows.
Mooblooms always spawn in flower forests so i made one for the mooblooms and they can have their Best friends the bees in case the mooblooms get lonely.
1. I will make other flower cows in case they have a spawn egg so that I Wouldn't have just dandelion mooblooms

I halfway think is is a good idea, because in Minecraft live the devs mentioned how the Warden might be friends with bunnies, but I think it should just follow the Warden, because if it benefits the Warden in any way, the Warden will be extremely hard to defeat. Maybe it could be to the players advantage, because the Warden could get distracted by the bunny. Maybe there could be Sculk carrots that the Warden could drop when you beat it or something that let you tame Sculk bunnies? I don’t know, I’m trailing off...

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.

Title: “Condor”

Text: “It would continue with the guideline of including animals that are in danger of extinction and it could be the first animal that flies freely through the skies of minecraft, it would fit well since we have the new mountains and they could put their nests on a snowy mountain or in a place that is difficult to access and that if we find an egg we will raise them and that the condor drinks that comes out we can tame it. And so he would wear something that represents Ecuador.”

- Translated by Admin
I can't understand 99% of that but Condors or just vultures would be a great inclusion.

Good work here. I also think that they should also:

pick up items that are dropped on the ground and place them in their nest, which can then be harvested, creating new types of farms,

And attack phantoms, who would then be scared of condors, allowing a way to get rid of phantoms/farm them if needed.
